GOD.content: Gospels: God maintains trace of his suffering by “seeing in secret,” you forget suffering in his love, he forgets nothing
GOD.linkedContent: Gospels: God maintains trace of his suffering by “seeing in secret,” you forget suffering in his love, he forgets nothing

GOD.content: the phrase [“pardon for not meaning (to say)…”] is “up in the air”: an appearance that comes from who knows where, contingency (touch, tact, contact), & pertinent (touching, tact, contact) > dwells suspended in air, even when it touches, meteoric, suspended like Abraham’s knife over Isaac’s head [re: scene of literature, secrecy, forgiveness]
GOD.linkedContent: the phrase [“pardon for not meaning (to say)…”] is “up in the air”: an appearance that comes from who knows where, contingency (touch, tact, contact), & pertinent (touching, tact, contact) > dwells suspended in air, even when it touches, meteoric, suspended like Abraham’s knife over Isaac’s head [re: scene of literature, secrecy, forgiveness]

GOD.content: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)
GOD.linkedContent: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)

GOD.content: w/ no witness, can only come down to us in the trace of an inheritance
GOD.linkedContent: w/ no witness, can only come down to us in the trace of an inheritance

GOD.content: after the flood, God reminds himself of the promise of the covenant, in the meteoric [trace] of a rainbow, that is, not merely in spontaneous, living, autoaffective memory [Derrida here showing literature’s relation to Jewish God]
GOD.linkedContent: after the flood, God reminds himself of the promise of the covenant, in the meteoric [trace] of a rainbow, that is, not merely in spontaneous, living, autoaffective memory [Derrida here showing literature’s relation to Jewish God]

GT.content: no problematic of gift on basis of metaphysics of presence, or sign, signifier, signified, or value > only w/ problematic of trace of text
GT.linkedContent: no problematic of gift on basis of metaphysics of presence, or sign, signifier, signified, or value > only w/ problematic of trace of text

MONL.content: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]
MONL.linkedContent: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]

MONL.content: translate memory of what was forbidden, did not take place, left a [hardly legible] trace, mark, scar
MONL.linkedContent: translate memory of what was forbidden, did not take place, left a [hardly legible] trace, mark, scar

MONL.content: what is the avowal, error, or defect, from which one must write?
MONL.linkedContent: what is the avowal, error, or defect, from which one must write?

R.content: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind
R.linkedContent: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind

R.content: every trace is a trace of democracy, of democracy there could only be a trace
R.linkedContent: every trace is a trace of democracy, of democracy there could only be a trace

FL.content: memory of undecidability must keep a living trace that forever marks a decision as such [is that possible? does that mark its death?]
FL.linkedContent: memory of undecidability must keep a living trace that forever marks a decision as such [is that possible? does that mark its death?]

FL.content: the undecidable remains caught, lodged, as a ghost, an essential ghost, in every decision, every event, the ghostliness deconstructs from within all assurance of presence
FL.linkedContent: the undecidable remains caught, lodged, as a ghost, an essential ghost, in every decision, every event, the ghostliness deconstructs from within all assurance of presence

LOBL.content: possible from “first trace” on, which is why there is no first trace: the outside opens a pocket [cf. F p. xix crypt: pocket of resistance]
LOBL.linkedContent: possible from “first trace” on, which is why there is no first trace: the outside opens a pocket [cf. F p. xix crypt: pocket of resistance]

LOBL.content: survivre delays at once life & death, line of least sure sur-, no clear-cut opposition, living on like differance, beyond identity & difference > tele-phone, tele-gram only 2 modes of this teleography in which trace, grapheme, does come secondarily but marks telic structure a priori
LOBL.linkedContent: survivre delays at once life & death, line of least sure sur-, no clear-cut opposition, living on like differance, beyond identity & difference > tele-phone, tele-gram only 2 modes of this teleography in which trace, grapheme, does come secondarily but marks telic structure a priori

LOBL.content: commitment only in the language of the other [see pp. 153-54], there is “language of the other” whenever there is a speech-event, this is what I mean by a “trace”
LOBL.linkedContent: commitment only in the language of the other [see pp. 153-54], there is “language of the other” whenever there is a speech-event, this is what I mean by a “trace”

LOBL.content: [trace as commitment to the other, the forgotten remnant in translation]
LOBL.linkedContent: [trace as commitment to the other, the forgotten remnant in translation]

AF.content: question of revelation (Offenbarung) or revealability (Offenbarkeit): does the event make the archivization possible? or vice versa? besides, the after-the-fact, the trace, Nachträglichkeit, disturbs the logic of the these two theses
AF.linkedContent: question of revelation (Offenbarung) or revealability (Offenbarkeit): does the event make the archivization possible? or vice versa? besides, the after-the-fact, the trace, Nachträglichkeit, disturbs the logic of the these two theses

MC.content: Derrida says mark, trace rather than signifier, letter, word, or the generality of stoikheion—to extend mark beyond verbal sign, beyond human language (and beyond atomism) > thus he does not affirm “arbitrariness of sign” like Hegel, Saussure
MC.linkedContent: Derrida says mark, trace rather than signifier, letter, word, or the generality of stoikheion—to extend mark beyond verbal sign, beyond human language (and beyond atomism) > thus he does not affirm “arbitrariness of sign” like Hegel, Saussure

SPOM.content: justice carries life beyond present life, not toward death but toward “living-on,” a trace where life and death are traces, of traces, a survival that dis-adjusts the identity of the living present, of effectivity
SPOM.linkedContent: justice carries life beyond present life, not toward death but toward “living-on,” a trace where life and death are traces, of traces, a survival that dis-adjusts the identity of the living present, of effectivity

SPOM.content: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism
SPOM.linkedContent: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism

POO.content: when all hypotheses are permitted, when there is no longer even any sense in making decisions about some secret behind the surface of a textual manifestation (text or trace), when it is the call of the secret, when our passion is aroused
POO.linkedContent: when all hypotheses are permitted, when there is no longer even any sense in making decisions about some secret behind the surface of a textual manifestation (text or trace), when it is the call of the secret, when our passion is aroused

POO.content: no responsiveness [in English], is that death [Levinas says so]? death dealt? I see no reason not to call that life, existence, trace [w/out being the contrary]
POO.linkedContent: no responsiveness [in English], is that death [Levinas says so]? death dealt? I see no reason not to call that life, existence, trace [w/out being the contrary]

POO.content: trace = grace: something rather than nothing

to speak of something w/out speaking of something [literature] valid for every trace, dissociation doesn’t need to be marked by words, doesn’t require la parole, can be mute deictic, gesture of animal [trace beyond human]
POO.linkedContent: to speak of something w/out speaking of something [literature] valid for every trace, dissociation doesn’t need to be marked by words, doesn’t require la parole, can be mute deictic, gesture of animal [trace beyond human]

HASD.content: differance and trace don’t arise from Being, from presence, even less from [negative theology’s] hyperessentiality
HASD.linkedContent: differance and trace don’t arise from Being, from presence, even less from [negative theology’s] hyperessentiality

HASD.content: from the moment I open my mouth, I have already promised at least to say: it is necessary to be silent > speak of the promise w/in the promise, as necessary as it is impossible: inscribes us by its trace in language—before language
HASD.linkedContent: from the moment I open my mouth, I have already promised at least to say: it is necessary to be silent > speak of the promise w/in the promise, as necessary as it is impossible: inscribes us by its trace in language—before language

HASD.content: garder pour soi, voilà le pouvoir le plus incroyable et qui donne le plus à penser > must there not be dissimulation, multiplicity & difference from oneself, trace, for there to be keeping?
HASD.linkedContent: garder pour soi, voilà le pouvoir le plus incroyable et qui donne le plus à penser > must there not be dissimulation, multiplicity & difference from oneself, trace, for there to be keeping?

HASD.content: [letter always arrives?] always possible to call on God, to call assumed origin of all speech by name of God, God always names trace of singular event rendering speech possible, all apophatic discourse opens w/ prayer
HASD.linkedContent: [letter always arrives?] always possible to call on God, to call assumed origin of all speech by name of God, God always names trace of singular event rendering speech possible, all apophatic discourse opens w/ prayer

HASD.content: always presupposed event, déjà-là, trace of phrase indispensable, irreducible, trace has taken place, even if contaminated by repetition which confers on it code & intelligibility, even if it occurs only to efface itself, effacement will have taken place, even if its place is only in ashes, il y a là cendre
HASD.linkedContent: always presupposed event, déjà-là, trace of phrase indispensable, irreducible, trace has taken place, even if contaminated by repetition which confers on it code & intelligibility, even if it occurs only to efface itself, effacement will have taken place, even if its place is only in ashes, il y a là cendre

HASD.content: trace as possibility of finitude, finite & infinite cause of trace appears secondary, an effect of trace or differance (which is finite insofar as it is infinite)
HASD.linkedContent: trace as possibility of finitude, finite & infinite cause of trace appears secondary, an effect of trace or differance (which is finite insofar as it is infinite)

HASD.content: no responsibility w/out prior coming of trace, or if autonomy were first & absolute [?]
HASD.linkedContent: no responsibility w/out prior coming of trace, or if autonomy were first & absolute [?]

MPM.content: this finitude (finitude of friendship) does not take the form of a limit, but takes the form of the trace of the other in us, the other’s irreducible presence
MPM.linkedContent: this finitude (finitude of friendship) does not take the form of a limit, but takes the form of the trace of the other in us, the other’s irreducible presence

MPM.content: any trace always trace of the other

il faut: one must follow the trace, remember that which did not exist, the law [Being and law], only there in the aporia of mourning and prosopopoeia: 1) success fails: other becomes part of us, bear him in us, like a future 2) failure succeeds: aborted interorization, respect for other as other, other remains alone, outside us, in his death > schema makes true mourning impossible
MPM.linkedContent: il faut: one must follow the trace, remember that which did not exist, the law [Being and law], only there in the aporia of mourning and prosopopoeia: 1) success fails: other becomes part of us, bear him in us, like a future 2) failure succeeds: aborted interorization, respect for other as other, other remains alone, outside us, in his death > schema makes true mourning impossible

MPM.content: parts, traces, hypomnemata of other are fragments that seem greater & older than us—pregnant w/ this other
MPM.linkedContent: parts, traces, hypomnemata of other are fragments that seem greater & older than us—pregnant w/ this other

MPM.content: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken > in trace, part greater/less than whole
MPM.linkedContent: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken > in trace, part greater/less than whole

MPM.content: Gedächtnis calls itself beyond interiorizing memory (Erinnerung), beyond inclusion of part in whole, thinks itself as a “part” which is greater than “whole” > trace beyond mournful memory
MPM.linkedContent: Gedächtnis calls itself beyond interiorizing memory (Erinnerung), beyond inclusion of part in whole, thinks itself as a “part” which is greater than “whole” > trace beyond mournful memory

MPM.content: other as other: “non-totalizable trace inadequate to itself and the same”
MPM.linkedContent: other as other: “non-totalizable trace inadequate to itself and the same”

MPM.content: where Derrida’s memory differentiates from Hegel’s: no link btwn Wesen & Gewesenheit, the present doesn’t pull from a past that was present, but a trace never present
MPM.linkedContent: where Derrida’s memory differentiates from Hegel’s: no link btwn Wesen & Gewesenheit, the present doesn’t pull from a past that was present, but a trace never present

MPM.content: for de Man, memory of traces of a past never present, which always remain to come—from the future, this promise of resurrection of anterior past, is a formal element, place where fictions & figures are elaborated
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, memory of traces of a past never present, which always remain to come—from the future, this promise of resurrection of anterior past, is a formal element, place where fictions & figures are elaborated

MPM.content: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]
MPM.linkedContent: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]

MPM.content: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other

A.content: border as limit (oros, Grenze, re: nun or Jetzt [now-point] Heidegger underlines) or border as tracing (grammē, Linie)
A.linkedContent: border as limit (oros, Grenze, re: nun or Jetzt [now-point] Heidegger underlines) or border as tracing (grammē, Linie)

A.content: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility
A.linkedContent: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility

VM.content: “doubtless, this encounter of the unforeseeable itself is the only possible opening of time, the only pure future, the only pure expenditure beyond history as economy, but this future, this beyond, is not another time, a day after history > it is present at the heart of experience, present not as a total presence but as a trace: therefore, before all dogmas, all conversions, all articles of faith or philosophy, experience itself is eschatological at its origin and in each of its aspects”
VM.linkedContent: “doubtless, this encounter of the unforeseeable itself is the only possible opening of time, the only pure future, the only pure expenditure beyond history as economy, but this future, this beyond, is not another time, a day after history > it is present at the heart of experience, present not as a total presence but as a trace: therefore, before all dogmas, all conversions, all articles of faith or philosophy, experience itself is eschatological at its origin and in each of its aspects”

VM.content: what if God is an effect of the trace?
VM.linkedContent: what if God is an effect of the trace?

VM.content: if other is called trace it can only be metaphorical, for it must be made to appear
VM.linkedContent: if other is called trace it can only be metaphorical, for it must be made to appear

POOF.content: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect
POOF.linkedContent: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect

SEC.content: for Condillac, trace means “to express,” “to represent,” “to recall,” “to make present”
SEC.linkedContent: for Condillac, trace means “to express,” “to represent,” “to recall,” “to make present”

PP.content: pure play of traces, supplements w/out transcendental signified, no absolutely external reference, on and on infinitely, is not w/out its own violence
PP.linkedContent: pure play of traces, supplements w/out transcendental signified, no absolutely external reference, on and on infinitely, is not w/out its own violence

PP.content: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm
PP.linkedContent: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm

PP.content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

PP.content: Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)
PP.linkedContent: Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)

PP.content: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play
PP.linkedContent: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play

PP.content: origin of the world as a trace, a receptacle, womb, matrix, w/out any form of presence or presence of form, because this would be an inscription w/in the mother
PP.linkedContent: origin of the world as a trace, a receptacle, womb, matrix, w/out any form of presence or presence of form, because this would be an inscription w/in the mother

PAS.content: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas
PAS.linkedContent: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas

VP.content: possibility of re-petition in its most general form, the trace in the most universal sense, inhabits pure actuality of now and constitutes now via differance
VP.linkedContent: possibility of re-petition in its most general form, the trace in the most universal sense, inhabits pure actuality of now and constitutes now via differance

VP.content: able to use language of trace w/out contradicting and erasing it immediately?
VP.linkedContent: able to use language of trace w/out contradicting and erasing it immediately?

VP.content: must think originary-being from trace, not trace from originary-being
VP.linkedContent: must think originary-being from trace, not trace from originary-being

VP.content: “trace is relation of intimacy of the living present to its outside,” to exteriority, to the non-proper, temporalization of sense is from its very beginning “spacing”
VP.linkedContent: “trace is relation of intimacy of the living present to its outside,” to exteriority, to the non-proper, temporalization of sense is from its very beginning “spacing”

S.content: double mark: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to the flame it divides
S.linkedContent: double mark: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to the flame it divides

FSW.content: necessity of archi-trace and erasure of archia [see POOF pp. 24, 32], erasure signifies conceived relationship of belonging to history of metaphysics
FSW.linkedContent: necessity of archi-trace and erasure of archia [see POOF pp. 24, 32], erasure signifies conceived relationship of belonging to history of metaphysics

FSW.content: “no doubt life protects itself by repetition, trace, differance”—but there’s no life present at first, life is trace so we can say life is death
FSW.linkedContent: “no doubt life protects itself by repetition, trace, differance”—but there’s no life present at first, life is trace so we can say life is death

FSW.content: distinction of force & meaning is derivative in relation to archi-trace
FSW.linkedContent: distinction of force & meaning is derivative in relation to archi-trace

FSW.content: writing as trace survives scratch’s present, punctuality, stigmē
traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

FSW.content: trace is constituted by its irremediable disappearance—disappearance of its disappearance, erasure of selfhood, of one’s own presence
FSW.linkedContent: trace is constituted by its irremediable disappearance—disappearance of its disappearance, erasure of selfhood, of one’s own presence

FSW.content: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible, escapes binarism and makes binarism possible on basis of nothing > useful to deconstruct logocentrism and to exercise at different levels of writing in general
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, erasure of trace, as movement of pure auto-affection, temporalization, makes repression “itself” possible, escapes binarism and makes binarism possible on basis of nothing > useful to deconstruct logocentrism and to exercise at different levels of writing in general

FSW.content: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ
FSW.linkedContent: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ

SH.content: given of date leaves its trace in the poem, the trace of the date is the poem
SH.linkedContent: given of date leaves its trace in the poem, the trace of the date is the poem

SH.content: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?
SH.linkedContent: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?

FWT.content: trace: not sign, not signifier, not anything present/absent
FWT.linkedContent: trace: not sign, not signifier, not anything present/absent

FWT.content: there is no absolute archive, and the trace is not a proof [re: authentic “parent”]
FWT.linkedContent: there is no absolute archive, and the trace is not a proof [re: authentic “parent”]

FWT.content: writing, trace, gramma or grapheme exceed opposition: human/nonhuman > extend field of living, or rather life/death relation
FWT.linkedContent: writing, trace, gramma or grapheme exceed opposition: human/nonhuman > extend field of living, or rather life/death relation

FWT.content: revenant different from specter/ghost (latter have horizons, are visible, come into light); revenant—think event & haunting together; revenant “almost” merges w/ trace itself
FWT.linkedContent: revenant different from specter/ghost (latter have horizons, are visible, come into light); revenant—think event & haunting together; revenant “almost” merges w/ trace itself

DS.content: if, in Mallarmé, mime mimics nothing, does the mime still mimic the “idea”? can Mimique be read as a neo-mimetologism? no, doesn’t even imitate, nothing prior to his gestures > no present has supervised the tracing of his writing
DS.linkedContent: if, in Mallarmé, mime mimics nothing, does the mime still mimic the “idea”? can Mimique be read as a neo-mimetologism? no, doesn’t even imitate, nothing prior to his gestures > no present has supervised the tracing of his writing

DS.content: Mallarmé: “passing butterfly leaves a bit of sharp ingenuous nothing” —about to break through hymen
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: “passing butterfly leaves a bit of sharp ingenuous nothing” —about to break through hymen

DS.content: if hymen constitutes itself as textual trace, if it always leaves something behind, it’s because its undecidability cuts it off from depending on any signified
DS.linkedContent: if hymen constitutes itself as textual trace, if it always leaves something behind, it’s because its undecidability cuts it off from depending on any signified

OS.content: Heidegger does not investigate hidden passageway (le passage dissimulé) that makes problem of presence communicate w/ the problem of the written trace
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger does not investigate hidden passageway (le passage dissimulé) that makes problem of presence communicate w/ the problem of the written trace

OS.content: time compared by Aristotle to movement and chance, w/out being either one of them, time can only occur en tēi psukhēi > time’s analogy: what is traced (le tracé) as line, grammē
OS.linkedContent: time compared by Aristotle to movement and chance, w/out being either one of them, time can only occur en tēi psukhēi > time’s analogy: what is traced (le tracé) as line, grammē

OS.content: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)

OS.content: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point
OS.linkedContent: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point

OS.content: we go around in circles trying to erase this circle > [time, still, introduces the thought of trace, if even to excise it]
OS.linkedContent: we go around in circles trying to erase this circle > [time, still, introduces the thought of trace, if even to excise it]

OS.content: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible
OS.linkedContent: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible

OS.content: only presence is mastered, trace (is) that which eludes mastery
OS.linkedContent: only presence is mastered, trace (is) that which eludes mastery

OS.content: trace in excess of presence-absence: leads to other text
OS.linkedContent: trace in excess of presence-absence: leads to other text

OS.content: difference btwn Being/beings, Heidegger’s discourse of trace > if difference (is) (itself) trace (neither presence nor absence): trace of trace has disappeared in the forgetting of the difference btwn Being/beings [forgetting of Being as annihilation of trace]
OS.linkedContent: difference btwn Being/beings, Heidegger’s discourse of trace > if difference (is) (itself) trace (neither presence nor absence): trace of trace has disappeared in the forgetting of the difference btwn Being/beings [forgetting of Being as annihilation of trace]

OS.content: presence, instead of being what sign signifies, is the trace of the trace (trace of the erasure of the trace)—Heidegger: distinction Being/beings left its trace as presence
OS.linkedContent: presence, instead of being what sign signifies, is the trace of the trace (trace of the erasure of the trace)—Heidegger: distinction Being/beings left its trace as presence

OS.content: trace cannot be illuminated, cannot be named as such, as such evades us forever
OS.linkedContent: trace cannot be illuminated, cannot be named as such, as such evades us forever

P.content: [Derrida makes his move] Kant assigns free beauty to framing-foliation, signifying nothing > having to be interrupted, sans-theme & sans-text relate to end as nonrelation, finality w/out end, but this sans must be marked, the trace [?] > parergon: place/structure of free beauty?
P.linkedContent: [Derrida makes his move] Kant assigns free beauty to framing-foliation, signifying nothing > having to be interrupted, sans-theme & sans-text relate to end as nonrelation, finality w/out end, but this sans must be marked, the trace [?] > parergon: place/structure of free beauty?

POS.content: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire
POS.linkedContent: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire

POS.content: there are only every differences & traces of traces [re: text, gram, differance, weave]
POS.linkedContent: there are only every differences & traces of traces [re: text, gram, differance, weave]

POS.content: hasn’t Derrida demonstrated that trace is neither ground, foundation, origin, can’t provide for manifest/disguised ontotheology? [still, he receives such criticisms]
POS.linkedContent: hasn’t Derrida demonstrated that trace is neither ground, foundation, origin, can’t provide for manifest/disguised ontotheology? [still, he receives such criticisms]

ROP.content: it is thus the trace that resists analysis
ROP.linkedContent: it is thus the trace that resists analysis

ROP.content: in prejudicative and prethetic sense, trace is an irreducible binding (Verbindung) that resists chemical analysis, there is no synthesis > does not bind presences or absences
ROP.linkedContent: in prejudicative and prethetic sense, trace is an irreducible binding (Verbindung) that resists chemical analysis, there is no synthesis > does not bind presences or absences

ROP.content: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]
ROP.linkedContent: double bind at work on examples of all undecidable figures (hymen, pharmakon…), carry predicates incompatible btwn themselves, in their very btwn, interlacing, sumplukē, chiasmatic invagination > but each one, in its sumplukē, makes up a single trace [?]

ROP.content: what rejects analysis: affirmation of gift as trace

ATIA.content: the question of whether animals can respond also concerns whether they can erase (s’effacer), can they lie, pretend, cover their own tracks
ATIA.linkedContent: the question of whether animals can respond also concerns whether they can erase (s’effacer), can they lie, pretend, cover their own tracks

ATIA.content: that traces can be erased, does not mean someone (man or animal) can erase them
ATIA.linkedContent: that traces can be erased, does not mean someone (man or animal) can erase them

ATIA.content: the animal sniffing out traces (which are always of an other), seeking to escape/find, privilege of smell (what happens when man stands up/represses smell)
ATIA.linkedContent: the animal sniffing out traces (which are always of an other), seeking to escape/find, privilege of smell (what happens when man stands up/represses smell)

ATIA.content: mark, gramma, trace, differance refer differentially to all living things, all relations btwn living and nonliving
ATIA.linkedContent: mark, gramma, trace, differance refer differentially to all living things, all relations btwn living and nonliving

ATIA.content: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure

ATIA.content: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure
ATIA.linkedContent: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure

DIF.content: trace as way out of closure of classical cause & effect (but not sufficient outside its text)
DIF.linkedContent: trace as way out of closure of classical cause & effect (but not sufficient outside its text)

DIF.content: [differance’s relation to trace] differance makes signification possible by assuring each “present” element relates to something other than itself, a trace of the future or past element
DIF.linkedContent: [differance’s relation to trace] differance makes signification possible by assuring each “present” element relates to something other than itself, a trace of the future or past element

DIF.content: privilege granted to consciousness, to the “living present”: power to synthesize traces, to constantly reassemble them
DIF.linkedContent: privilege granted to consciousness, to the “living present”: power to synthesize traces, to constantly reassemble them

DIF.content: Spur and Bahnung in Freud: inseparable from differance, no breach w/out difference, no difference w/out trace: movement of trace, in Freud, a protection, deferring danger by constituting a reserve (Vorrat) > each of Freud’s concepts a detour in economy of differance
DIF.linkedContent: Spur and Bahnung in Freud: inseparable from differance, no breach w/out difference, no difference w/out trace: movement of trace, in Freud, a protection, deferring danger by constituting a reserve (Vorrat) > each of Freud’s concepts a detour in economy of differance

DIF.content: Levinas’ trace, enigma of absolute alterity (a past never present), solicits domination of beings (w/in these limits, differance implies Levinas’ entire critique of classical ontology)
DIF.linkedContent: Levinas’ trace, enigma of absolute alterity (a past never present), solicits domination of beings (w/in these limits, differance implies Levinas’ entire critique of classical ontology)

DIF.content: cannot think trace (therefore differance) on basis of presence: refers to a past never present
DIF.linkedContent: cannot think trace (therefore differance) on basis of presence: refers to a past never present

DIF.content: differance would be play of trace which no longer belongs to horizon of Being
DIF.linkedContent: differance would be play of trace which no longer belongs to horizon of Being

DIF.content: a trace that can never appear in phenomenon: trace beyond link btwn ontology & phenomenology > trace erases itself, muffles itself in resonating, like the “a” inscribing its pyramid in differance
DIF.linkedContent: a trace that can never appear in phenomenon: trace beyond link btwn ontology & phenomenology > trace erases itself, muffles itself in resonating, like the “a” inscribing its pyramid in differance

DIF.content: the annunciating and reserved trace can be disclosed in metaphysical discourse when stating closure of ontology (Levinas, Freud, Nietzsche, and especially Heidegger)
DIF.linkedContent: the annunciating and reserved trace can be disclosed in metaphysical discourse when stating closure of ontology (Levinas, Freud, Nietzsche, and especially Heidegger)

DIF.content: trace & difference cannot appear as such, sheltered (s’abrite)/dissimulated in names (received in metaphysical text)
DIF.linkedContent: trace & difference cannot appear as such, sheltered (s’abrite)/dissimulated in names (received in metaphysical text)

DIF.content: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace
DIF.linkedContent: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace

DIF.content: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace
DIF.linkedContent: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace

DIF.content: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice
DIF.linkedContent: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice

DIF.content: text of metaphysics is comprehended (compris) > encore lisible, and to be read: not surrounded but traversed by limit, marked in its interior by multiple furrow (sillon) of its margin
DIF.linkedContent: text of metaphysics is comprehended (compris) > encore lisible, and to be read: not surrounded but traversed by limit, marked in its interior by multiple furrow (sillon) of its margin

CHM.content: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole not antagonistic to silence but its condition, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)
CHM.linkedContent: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole not antagonistic to silence but its condition, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)

RGE.content: Bataille against servile writing (not irresponsible techne of Plato) that serves life, phantom of life, in presence, advocates a trace w/ possibility of effacement absolu > unerasable trace not a trace
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille against servile writing (not irresponsible techne of Plato) that serves life, phantom of life, in presence, advocates a trace w/ possibility of effacement absolu > unerasable trace not a trace

PIO.content: reflexive structure that does not produce presence but follows a trace, “self-reflexivity” of de Man [Gasché’s interp. of Derrida?]
PIO.linkedContent: reflexive structure that does not produce presence but follows a trace, “self-reflexivity” of de Man [Gasché’s interp. of Derrida?]

PIO.content: tain prohibits transparency & authorizes invention of mirror, is a trace of language
PIO.linkedContent: tain prohibits transparency & authorizes invention of mirror, is a trace of language

PIO.content: tain (btwn 2 lines) is language itself [“word”] (associates/dissociates forever: Eros/Psyche) [tain like hymen?]: an unbearable violence, a perversion that obeys law of language
PIO.linkedContent: tain (btwn 2 lines) is language itself [“word”] (associates/dissociates forever: Eros/Psyche) [tain like hymen?]: an unbearable violence, a perversion that obeys law of language

PIO.content: to call all invention that of mark/trace (rather than language), btwn culture & nature: man/animal opposition [cf. Bergson on p. 418n] no longer accredited, privileges the postal, movement of envoi, differance
PIO.linkedContent: to call all invention that of mark/trace (rather than language), btwn culture & nature: man/animal opposition [cf. Bergson on p. 418n] no longer accredited, privileges the postal, movement of envoi, differance

PF.content: one trace always refers to another, secretes, cannot not produce alibi: ubiquity of alibi
PF.linkedContent: one trace always refers to another, secretes, cannot not produce alibi: ubiquity of alibi

PF.content: a trace w/out alibi resists thinking, paralyzes, also only chance to not give in to paralysis
PF.linkedContent: a trace w/out alibi resists thinking, paralyzes, also only chance to not give in to paralysis

PF.content: can there be a trace (and thus alibi) elsewhere than scene of culpa-responsi-bility, scene of debt, duty (Schuld, Schuldigsein)? an originary alibi that precedes juridico-ethico-political, but isn’t ontological neutrality?
PF.linkedContent: can there be a trace (and thus alibi) elsewhere than scene of culpa-responsi-bility, scene of debt, duty (Schuld, Schuldigsein)? an originary alibi that precedes juridico-ethico-political, but isn’t ontological neutrality?

PF.content: is the injunction to answer (answer to, answer for) inscribed right on the trace?
PF.linkedContent: is the injunction to answer (answer to, answer for) inscribed right on the trace?

PF.content: does law, morality, politics determine through & through the thinking of trace/alibi? no
PF.linkedContent: does law, morality, politics determine through & through the thinking of trace/alibi? no

TR.content: Rousseau gave such emphasis/privilege to his theft (at age 16), and de Man hounds him, s’acharne sur lui, as if he where after him in this trace
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau gave such emphasis/privilege to his theft (at age 16), and de Man hounds him, s’acharne sur lui, as if he where after him in this trace

EJQB.content: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue
EJQB.linkedContent: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue

D.content: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure
D.linkedContent: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure

D.content: tracing not simply mere other or outside of erasing: can only trace itself out in in the erasure of its own “presence”
D.linkedContent: tracing not simply mere other or outside of erasing: can only trace itself out in in the erasure of its own “presence”

LI.content: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable
LI.linkedContent: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable

LI.content: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience
LI.linkedContent: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience

ATM.content: otherwise (autrement), the adverb in Otherwise than Being which wins out immeasurably over a verb, the beyond of the symplokē [linking nouns & verbs, that of essence], leaving a chain of traces, another symplokē [beyond essence]
ATM.linkedContent: otherwise (autrement), the adverb in Otherwise than Being which wins out immeasurably over a verb, the beyond of the symplokē [linking nouns & verbs, that of essence], leaving a chain of traces, another symplokē [beyond essence]

ATM.content: passage beyond language requires language, or requires text as a place for the trace of a step (pas) that passes beyond language, not (present) elsewhere [not classical]
ATM.linkedContent: passage beyond language requires language, or requires text as a place for the trace of a step (pas) that passes beyond language, not (present) elsewhere [not classical]

ATM.content: if the State leaves a trace of interruptions too, how does Levinas’ tracing of them differ? it ties together interruptions btwn threads [i.e. doesn’t tie threads], a series out of series (hors-série) > series: hiatus must insist
ATM.linkedContent: if the State leaves a trace of interruptions too, how does Levinas’ tracing of them differ? it ties together interruptions btwn threads [i.e. doesn’t tie threads], a series out of series (hors-série) > series: hiatus must insist

ATM.content: Levinas obligates w/out constraint, by way of nonphenomenality, to read the trace as trace, interruption as interruption (i.e. acc. as such no longer reappropriable as phenomenon of essence)
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas obligates w/out constraint, by way of nonphenomenality, to read the trace as trace, interruption as interruption (i.e. acc. as such no longer reappropriable as phenomenon of essence)

ATM.content: Levinas: the substitution of the hostage discovers the trace
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: the substitution of the hostage discovers the trace

ATM.content: if Levinas insists on superimposing the trace, leaving a trace, entracing, how can we dissociate this trace from a sign?
ATM.linkedContent: if Levinas insists on superimposing the trace, leaving a trace, entracing, how can we dissociate this trace from a sign?

EW.content: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man
EW.linkedContent: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man

TINON.content: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience
TINON.linkedContent: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience

AD.content: Levinas: to be “in the image of God” is not to be an icon of God, but to find oneself in his trace (Exodus 33)
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: to be “in the image of God” is not to be an icon of God, but to find oneself in his trace (Exodus 33)

AD.content: [sweet Derrida] miracle of trace allows us to read Levinas and have meaning for us today
AD.linkedContent: [sweet Derrida] miracle of trace allows us to read Levinas and have meaning for us today

CIN.content: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine
CIN.linkedContent: best paradigm for trace not the trail of the hunt, le frayage, wake in sea, nor love of step (pas) for its imprint, but the cinder (what remains w/out remaining from holocaust, from the all-burning [du brûle-tout]) > no longer makes a trace, or traces only by losing trace qu’elle reste à peine

CIN.content: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory
CIN.linkedContent: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory

SPEC.content: all these silences by which a trace works on a text, not indivisible simplicity of limes or marginal trait (S is P, “this has [not] been thought”)—rather: the non-thematized, implicit, mode of foreclosure, disavowal…
SPEC.linkedContent: all these silences by which a trace works on a text, not indivisible simplicity of limes or marginal trait (S is P, “this has [not] been thought”)—rather: the non-thematized, implicit, mode of foreclosure, disavowal…
